meanings.definition: A type of footwear typically worn in South Asia, consisting of a sole attached to the foot by a strap.
meanings.sent1: She slipped on her chappals before heading out.
meanings.sent2: The children ran around the house in their colorful chappals.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally wore mismatched chappals to the party.
meanings.sent4: The sound of chappals clicking on the pavement filled the street.
meanings.sent5: Her favorite pair of chappals had intricate designs on the straps.

meanings.definition: To hit or slap someone with a chappal as a form of punishment or discipline.
meanings.sent1: The angry mother threatened to chappal her misbehaving child.
meanings.sent2: In the old days, teachers would chappal students for being late.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would chappal his friend if he didn't stop talking.
meanings.sent4: The coach chappaled the player's ego with harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The idea of chappaling someone for a mistake seems outdated now.
